thread.title: Meet BSF's First Ever Female Combat Officer: A 25-Year-Old From Rajasthan
thread.title_full: Meet BSF's First Ever Female Combat Officer: A 25-Year-Old From Rajasthan

title: Meet BSF's First Ever Female Combat Officer: A 25-Year-Old From Rajasthan
text: facebook For the first time in the 51 years of its existence, the Border Security Force has appointed a female combat officer who will become a part of the border protection force. Tanushree Pareek, a 25-year-old hailing from Bikaner, led 67 trainee officers in the graduation parade at Tekanpur, and is all set to command a unit at the India-Pakistan border in Punjab. She has completed an intense 52-week training, which included intelligence gathering and battle craft. Although the BSF started taking female applicants in 2013, Pareek has been the first one to successfully finish the training and join the forces, along with 2.5 lakh men. #BSF Gets First Woman Field Officer After 51 Years. Tanushree Pareek, She's From Bikaner.India Is Proud Of You.
